session-tasks.name: agile-intro
session-tasks.title: Introduction to Agile
session-tasks.description: In this lesson we will introduce you to the Agile Methodology, teach you about Agile's History and tell you how popular Agile is today

session-tasks.name: case-study-backlog
session-tasks.title: Designing a Product Backlog
session-tasks.description: Based on the Case Study and Your Position in the Case Study you will be required to create a list of requirements which will be known as the Product Backlog. A Submission of the Product Backlog will allow you to continue to the next stage.

session-tasks.name: agile
session-tasks.title: Agile Quiz!
session-tasks.description: Asp.Net Quiz (contains webform, mvc, web API, etc.)

questions.name: An Agile approach is best suited for projects that have high levels of uncertainty
Documentation is never appropriate in an Agile project
It is impossible to estimate the costs and schedules of an Agile project
An Agile project is more likely to result in maximizing the business value the customer receives from the project
Reduced overhead and faster time to market are generally characteristics of an Agile approach
An Agile approach should generally result in producing higher levels of quality in the finished product because quality is a more integral part of the development effort
Scope creep in an Agile project is normal and is to be expected
An Agile approach will ALWAYS result in fastest time to market
An Agile approach would normally NOT be the most appropriate choice for a project that requires a high level of predictability such as a construction project
A traditional plan-driven approach (or Waterfall) would be a good approach to use if you were to take on a highly uncertain project such as finding a cure for cancer

session-tasks.name: scrum
session-tasks.title: Scrum Quiz!
session-tasks.description: Scrum.Net Quiz (contains webform, mvc, web API, etc.)

questions.name: Scrum is the most widely used Agile methodology to the extent that when people talk about 'Agile', they are many times talking about the Scrum methodology and not a more general Agile approach
The purpose of ALL Sprints is to release a piece of working software
Items at the bottom of the Product Backlog are usually larger than those on the top
An advantage of a defined process is that it is repeatable and predictable
Which of the following is the subject of Sprint Retrospective?
Who participates in the Sprint Review?
Who is allowed to change the Sprint Backlog during the Sprint?
The Product Owner and the Scrum Master Cannot be a part of the Development Team
When should the Sprint Retrospective be held?

options.name: When asked by the Product Owner
When asked by the Scrum Master

questions.name: The Sprint Backlog would not change after the Sprint Planning

session-tasks.name: agile-intro
session-tasks.title: Introduction to Agile
session-tasks.description: In this lesson we will introduce you to the Agile Methodology, teach you about Agile's History and tell you how popular Agile is today
session-tasks.content: Agile by itself is nothing more than a set of principles and values created by developers alike with the ambition to standardise the future of project development. Those principals came to be known as the Agile Manifesto.

session-tasks.name: sprint-planning
session-tasks.title: Introduction to Agile
session-tasks.description: An Introduction into Session 2 and what you will complete by the end of the Session. How the Scrum roles will be utilised throughout the Session
session-tasks.content: Agile by itself is nothing more than a set of principles and values created by developers alike with the ambition to standardise the future of project development. Those principals came to be known as the Agile Manifesto.

questions.name: ASP.NET webform separates the HTML output from program logic using a feature named as
The feature in ASP.NET 2.0 that is used to fire a normal postback to a different page in the application is called
